newsitem.title: GREECE: TAX STAMP ON FX LOANS, TRANSACTIONS WORRIES GREEK BANKERS.
newsitem.headline: TAX STAMP ON FX LOANS, TRANSACTIONS WORRIES GREEK BANKERS.

text.p: The abolition of a previous tax stamp exemption on forex bank loans to clients and interbank forex loans and depos has sent shivers through the Greek banking community.

Bankers said they were seeking clarification of chapter 5, article 4, paragraph 5 of the draft bill on the elimination of tax exemptions that was submitted to parliament on Wednesday from the finance ministry.

The imposition of the 0.3 percent tax stamp will raise the cost of forex loans to bank clients by a minimum 30 basis points but it could cause havoc if levied on interbank forex transactions, bankers said.
They expressed optimism that the issue will be clarified soon and will not affect interbank deals.
Some bankers said the tax stamp amounted to 3.4 percent instead of 0.3 percent. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
